assetProfile.longBusinessSummary: Bourbon Corporation manufactures and sells food and beverage products in Japan. The company offers cookies, wheat flour crackers, bean snacks, candies, deserts, rice biscuits, snacks, delicacies, chocolates, chewing gums, mineral water, coffee, cocoa beverages, and other soft drinks; and powdered cocoa, liquor, rice, bread, and instant ramen. It markets its products through vending machines and mail orders. The company was formerly known as Kitanihon Shokuhin Kogyo Corporation and changed its name to Bourbon Corporation in June 1989. Bourbon Corporation was incorporated in 1924 and is headquartered in Kashiwazaki, Japan.
